course.title: Marie de France and Chretien de Troyes or the Beginning of Modern Fiction
course.description: We will read the complete works of the most famous French authors of the twelfth century: Marie de France's Lais, Fables, and Purgatory of St. Patrick; Chretien de Troyes's five Arthurian romances, two love songs, and adaptation of Ovid's story of Philomela. We will also read other contemporary narrative works, helping us to reflect on the role of fiction in medieval culture and in our own culture.
course.notes: Course in French. Reading in Modern French.
